bibl.title: M. L. Coovert for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1890-1901, vol 1

div1.p: Supreme Court of the United States. No. 91, October term 1896.
The State of Washington vs. M. L. Coovert
Filed July 23 1898 In the U. S. Circuit Court. A. Reeves Ayres Clerk HM Walker Deputy

You, therefore, are hereby commanded that such execution and further proceedings be had in said cause, in conformity with the opinion and decree of this Court as according to right and justice, and the laws of the United States, ought to be had, the said appeal notwithstanding.
Witness the Honorable Melwille W. Fuller, Chief Justice of the United States, the 22d day of July, in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and ninety-seven.
Costs of The State of Washington Clerk $26.00 Printing record $16.50 Attorney $20.00 $62.50
James H. M. Kenney Clerk of the Supreme Court of the United States
